data.name: School Class Arrangement
data.description:
The school year has started and students will be back to school. The school principle wants to arrange the classes in a specific pattern.
The students must be arranged in desks by their surnames and if more than two students have same surnames arrange by first name. In each desk there should be one male and one female. Each desk is considered a list. Empty desks must be of None values. There must be 10 desks in the class aka list.

*Hint: Arrange males and females seperately*

`Input: list of students and their information as dictionaries`

`Output: list of students as string of first and last name arranged in desks`

`Output Formula:  [['Sam Scott','Anna Johnson'],['Harry Stewart','Sarah Brown'],...] `

Example:

*Input:*

```python

data = [
	{'name': 'Jake','surname': 'Williams' , 'gender': 'male'},
	{'name': 'Paul','surname': 'Williams' , 'gender': 'male'},
	{'name': 'Samantha','surname': 'Brown' , 'gender': 'female'},
	{'name': 'Maria','surname': 'Johnson' , 'gender': 'female'},
	{'name': 'Paul','surname': 'Zimmer' , 'gender': 'male'},
	{'name': 'Ricardo','surname': 'Gomez' , 'gender': 'male'},
	{'name': 'Tina','surname': 'Martinez' , 'gender': 'female'},
	{'name': 'Larissa','surname': 'Stewart' , 'gender': 'female'}]

ArrangeClass(data)
```

*Output:*

```python

[['Ricardo Gomez', 'Samantha Brown'], ['Jake Williams', 'Maria Johnson'], ['Paul Williams', 'Tina Martinez'], ['Paul Zimmer', 'Larissa Stewart'], [None, None], [None, None], [None, None], [None, None], [None, None], [None, None]]
```
